file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-44-11-05 - EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to adjust the Emergency/Parking Brake. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE - AD- ALL 32-44-11-700-801-A JUSTMENT EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-44-11 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-44-11-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE - ADJUSTMENT A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to adjust the Emergency/Parking Brake. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200 HTS AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200 LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE SYSTEM - FUNC- AMM TASK 32-44-00-700-801-A/500 TIONAL CHECK LUBRICATE EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE CON- AMM TASK 32-44-10-600-801-A/300 TROL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the hands 1 available Fluid Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the eyes 1 available Base, Fluid Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task NLG bay I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Get access to the nose landing gear (NLG) bay. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 32-44-11 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Make sure that the safety pins are installed on the landing gears ( AMM TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A/200). J. Adjustment of the Emergency/Parking Brake (Figure 501) SUBTASK 720-002-A WARNING: OBEY ALL SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS RELATED TO THE SKYDROL FLUID. CAUTION: OBEY THE SAFETY LIMIT FOR THE LENGTH OF THE TURNBUCKLE, LEAVE A MAXIMUM OF THREE THREADS SHOWN. REFER TO FIGURE 501. (1) Operate the emergency/Parking Brake handle and adjust the "gap" between the stop pin (see Figure 501) and related stop. To do this, use the turnbuckle. NOTE: • The emergency/parking brake control cable does not have tension, then it can be a little free (not stretched). • To prevent hydraulic fluid transference from system 1 to system 2 or vice versa, first apply brakes with the pedals and then pull or release the emergency/parking brake handle. (2) Energize the aircraft with the External DC Power Supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (3) Pressurize the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). (4) Operate the Emergency/Parking Brake handle to make sure it operates, locks, and unlocks smoothly. NOTE: To prevent hydraulic fluid transference from system 1 to system 2 or vice versa, first apply brakes with the pedals and then pull or release the emergency/parking brake handle. (5) Turn off hydraulic system 2 only ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). (6) Do the functional check of the Emergency/Parking Brake ( AMM TASK 32-44-00-700-801-A/500). (7) Make sure that the emergency/parking brake handle is free movement and properly lubricated. Refer to AMM TASK 32-44-10-600-801-A/300. (8) If necessary, use the turnbuckle to adjust the control cable of the Emergency/Parking Brake until you do step 7. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Release the pressure from the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/ 200). (2) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200).
